sentences.sContent: An unavoidable by-product of burning oil is carbon dioxide, and carbon dioxide harms the environment.
sentences.sContent_eng: An unavoidable by-product of burning oil is carbon dioxide, and carbon dioxide harms the environment.
sentences.sCn: 使用石油不可避免的副产品就是二氧化碳，这是对环境有害的气体。

sentences.sContent: This all has to do with photosynthesis, the process in which plants turn sunlight, carbon dioxide and water into food.
sentences.sContent_eng: This all has to do with photosynthesis, the process in which plants turn sunlight, carbon dioxide and water into food.
sentences.sCn: 这一切都与光合作用有关，在这一过程中，植物将阳光、二氧化碳和水转变为食物。

sentences.sContent: She is your indispensable oxygen, carbon dioxide is not essential you me.
sentences.sContent_eng: She is your indispensable oxygen, carbon dioxide is not essential you me.
sentences.sCn: 她是你不可缺少的氧气，我是你可有可无的二氧化碳。

trans.tranOther: the gas produced when animals breathe out, when carbon is burned in air, or when animal or vegetable substances decay
